info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 6:32AM CDT until June 08 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HIDALGO...NORTHWESTERN CAMERON AND SOUTHWESTERN WILLACY COUNTIES... At 632 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lyford to Tierra Bonita to Mila Doce, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Edinburg, Harlingen, Weslaco, Alamo, Donna, Raymondville, Elsa, Edcouch, Santa Rosa and Lyford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
